attributes.action: Reinstate the rail link from Poulton le Fylde to Fleetwood Lancashire
attributes.background: The rail link was closed in 1980’s. There is a need in Fleetwood for decent transport links on the grounds of deprivation and poor economy. People have to travel for an hour during rush hour to get to the nearest station 5 miles away. Commuter rail is essential to rebuild our economy.
attributes.additional_details: Fleetwood is on a peninsula and since the 1970’s has been in decline. We now have a division one football club, the only one with no rail link, and things are on the up though people cannot get in and out of town for university and work due to its positioning on the Fylde coast. We are a beautiful town with an amazing coastline which we cannot share properly due to poor transport links. Most of the track is in place just no trains running. Fleetwood has great potential please help it thrive.

attributes.action: Allow carers to study more than 21 hours a week and claim Carers Allowance
attributes.background:
Carers cannot be in full time education and claim Carers Allowance even if they are caring for the 35-hours a week to make them eligible for this benefit. 
This particularly discriminates against young adult carers reaching their full potential in life. 
See www.fixers.org.uk (Lucy Prentice)
attributes.additional_details:
There are 168 hours in each week, so even after deducting 35 hours of caring this still leaves 133 hours which the carer should be able to spend as they wish without restriction in the same way that anyone in paid employment can. It is completely feasible that a carer can provide the number of caring hours required to meet the eligibility for Carers Allowance and still study full time around their caring role.
Please see the film by Lucy Prentice and other young adult carers at www.fixers.org.uk

attributes.action: Cyclists must take a road test, be Licensed and Insured to be on the road.
attributes.background: In light of the recent deaths involving cyclists causing harm or even death to pedestrian or themselves, please sign this petition so that it becomes a legal requirement to undertake a road safety test so to gain license and also have insurance like every other user on the roads.

attributes.action: Investigate whether David Davis lied to Parliament about Impact Assessments
attributes.background:
David Davis informed parliament that his department would carry out impact reports detailing the financial impact of Brexit on the UK economy.

However these reports do not exist. I am calling for this to be properly investigated, and the correct action to be taken.
attributes.additional_details:
In December 2016, Secretary of State for Exiting the EU David Davis informed parliament that his department would carry out “about 57 sets of analyses”. These would detail the financial impact of Brexit on sectors vital to the UK economy.
 
On 6th December 2017, David Davis admitted that these reports do not exist. I am calling for this to be properly investigated, and the correct action to be taken.

attributes.action: Remove rip-off compound interest from student loans
attributes.background: Student loans charge a huge 6.1% interest, even during study. Worse, the 6.1% is compounded monthly, meaning interest is added to the loans every month, making loans bigger, so the next month the interest costs even more; the loans get bigger and interest costs increase every month. It is a rip-off.
attributes.additional_details: Even though the base rate is only 0.25%, students are exploited by horrendous 6.1% interest, compounded monthly, being charged on their loans – this can double or treble the size of the loans and massively increase interest costs, too. Most ‘normal’ loans do not do this. It is exploitative. No wonder student loans get bigger even while borrowers are paying off their loans. Sign the petition to remove interest from student loans. More info. here: https://www.afairdealforstudents.com/

attributes.action: Having knocked over a cat, the driver must legally stop to help/trace the owner
attributes.background: We have lost two cats to road traffic accidents. On both occasions the drivers did not stop to check if the cat could be saved. It is a criminal offence not to stop and report an accident involving a dog. Whilst cats are more independent they are still a beloved pet and should be respected equally.

attributes.action: Introduce an unconditional, Universal Basic Income
attributes.background:
With ever more jobs becoming automatable, risking vast unemployment, a regular unconditional dividend should be paid to every citizen to provide a decent standard of living and stimulate the economy from the bottom up.

This will also reduce crime, healthcare costs and improve education outcomes.
attributes.additional_details:
Here is a further list of reasons to pay a basic income: http://www.basicincome.org.uk/reasons-support-basic-income

And some preliminary results from a trial in Finland: https://www.weforum.org/agenda/2017/05/finlands-basic-income-experiment-is-already-making-people-feel-better-after-just-4-months

And a study into the likely impact of automation on future employment:
http://www.oxfordmartin.ox.ac.uk/downloads/academic/The_Future_of_Employment.pdf

attributes.action: Change CICA policy that states children age 12+ can “consent in fact” to sex
attributes.background:
Children from age 12y could be refused compensation for sexual abuse on grounds they consented under revised rules.
The Criminal Injuries Compensation Authority (CICA) review of its guidelines revealed that almost 700 child victims were denied payments, even where the attacker was jailed.
attributes.additional_details:
The age of consent is 16 for good reason. It reflects the cognitive, emotional and social development required as an absolute minimum to consent to sex. The current CICA guidelines flies in face of this, notwithstanding ignoring the context in which "consent" occurs. Coercion, fear and manipulation are part of these offences and as such "consent in fact" is null and void. 
Such victim blaming is wrong, unhelpful and psychologically damaging. As such, this should be fully debated in Parliament.

attributes.action: Ban non biodegradable plastic in food/drink packaging. Switch to hemp plastic.
attributes.background: Most drink bottles, tubs and other food packaging are made from petroleum based plastic. This is are toxic to the environment and takes 1000's of years (if ever) to break down. It is polluting the oceans and soil. Eco friendly biodegradable hemp plastic exists but is currently not being used.
attributes.additional_details:
Every week we (in the UK) bury 1000's of tonnes of plastic food and drink packaging. 
More makes its way into the rivers and oceans. It causes massive pollution harming both us and wildlife.
There is an environmentally friendly alternative. Hemp based plastic exists, but at the moment it is not used. 
Mostly because it is not well known about and there is no major manufacturing of it like there is for petroleum based plastics.
For our health and the environment we should make its use mandatory.

attributes.action: I want our country to increase our defence budget to 5% GDP to protect us better
attributes.background: We need to increase our defence budget. The world today is even more unpredictable and dangerous than it's ever been, from the likes of Russia and China being more assertive. I want the UK to be prepared for any major conflict that may come to light in the future and protect our citizens better.

attributes.action: Repeal the 1939 Cancer Act so that doctors can offer alternatives to chemo
attributes.background: Doctors are not legally allowed to offer or advise on alternatives for fear of criminal prosecution and the loss of their license to practice.

attributes.action: To have a second referendum on Brexit once a final agreement with the EU agreed.
attributes.background: Whether we stay or go, I believe that final decision should only be based on clear and understandable information. It is clear that our and EU politicians are more interested in their own politicking rather than ensuring a stable and highly productive Country/Countries.
attributes.additional_details: Inner city Manchester Born and Bred. Degree in Economics. Lived in Moss Side/Whalley Range, Weybridge, Warsaw, Geneva and now back in Weybridge. Have two exceptional daughters for whom I have the only desire to leave a better world for them and future generations. Incredible friends around the world. Together we are something, alone we are nothing. Let's make sure any decision we reach is based on fact not fiction.

attributes.action: Lift the ban on hand guns and allow everyone to own any firearm.
attributes.background: It's about time the ban on handguns and civilians owning them was lifted. The only people affected by the ban are law abiding citizens that lost their right to own firearms. The ban hasn't stopped criminals from buying or using firearms at all.

attributes.action: Stop development on Green Belt land and prevent de-designation of Green Belt.
attributes.background: We call upon Parliament to fully support measures to stop development on green belt land and to prevent de-designation of green belt land, to halt the coalescence of villages such as Kings Langley into neighbouring towns thus permanently losing their character.
attributes.additional_details: Green Belt is under increasing threat and it is time to say 'enough' - no more building on precious open spaces between towns and villages because it is irreplaceable.  There are other places to build than on the Green Belt - keep it untouched for the generations to follow.

attributes.action: Sex crimes against children to receive harsher penalties and mandatory jail time
attributes.background: Paedophiles who arrange to meet children, help facilitate attacks over the internet, download child pornography or sexually abuse children are often getting very little if at all any jail time; this is not a deterrent to those who seek out our children for their own twisted needs.
attributes.additional_details: It's about time paedophiles are scared of the sentences given at court to deter them from their crimes. No crime is victimless; children are abused so others can download the pictures therefore facilitating this crime. Parents and non parents are outraged when a shoplifter can get a heavier sentence than those who destroy the souls of our children and it's about time that stopped.

attributes.action: Introduce an Electronic Voting System to stop Voting Fraud
attributes.background: Voting Fraud is happening in the UK
attributes.additional_details:
The people of the UK request that before the next General Election a new voting procedure be put into place.     The system should  have the ability to stamp out voter fraud and should be able to check for multiple voting  which is happening  in some areas of the UK.      Some form of electronic voting using your  National Insurance number or even the issuing an identify card would be ideal.  

Postal voting should only be available to the elderly and severely disabled.    

Penalties for illegal voting and multiple voting should be severe and classed as a criminal conviction, a £5,000 fine, and a ban from voting for at least 10 years.

The voting system should apply to the whole of the UK.... no exceptions

attributes.action: Political Education to be put on the National Curriculum.
attributes.background: We are told how important it is to vote and to be politically aware so why isn't politics on the National Curriculum? We should be taught the importance of being able to vote and the history behind it, how party's differ and how our Parliament is made.

attributes.action: Make performing a cosmetic surgical procedure without relevant insurance illegal
attributes.background: Practitioners who choose to operate without relevant insurance and who make mistakes are ruining lives and costing the NHS millions of pounds for putting right botched operations.  Rogue practitioners currently do not face the threat of criminal action if they don't have relevant insurance in place.
attributes.additional_details: The past 10 years has seen a significant increase in cosmetic procedures carried out in the UK within an industry which remains largely unregulated.  Consequently, there has also been an alarming increase in patients using NHS services to correct failed cosmetic procedures as a result of under-insured /uninsured practitioners. Due to a long existing  data vacuum, the true cost to the NHS is unknown, potentially running to tens of thousands per patient.

attributes.action: The government must ring-fence mental health budgets.
attributes.background:
Mental health staff numbers are not increasing at anything like the rate the government claims. The government announced additional funding for mental health, but not all the money pledged is reaching the front line. The government must agree to ring-fence mental health budgets.

.
attributes.additional_details:
Two years ago, the government announced additional funding for mental health - £1.4 billion over five years to deliver the Five Year Forward View for Mental Health and £1.25 billion for the Future In Mind programme for Child and Adolescent Mental Health Services. 
We know however that not all the money pledged is reaching the front line. Too many Clinical Commissioning Groups – the bodies that decide how money is spent locally – are using the money for other services.
#mentalhealthmatters

attributes.action: Please grant Michael Holmes a UK Residency Card to remain with his wife Iwona.
attributes.background: I am an American who has lived in the UK for 3 years with my Polish wife who is a NHS staff nurse. We were married in 2015 and known each other 5 years.
attributes.additional_details: I was denied a residency card and it was allowed by appeal. The Home Office retaliated with a section 10 removal notice to deport me. This has now been rescinded but I still don’t know if I will be granted a residency card.

attributes.action: Making false claims about military service should be a criminal offence
attributes.background: There seems to be an occurring theme in professional ex-service members lying or exaggerating their military service to enhance their professional or political career. It should be made a criminal offence to lie about one’s military career for personal gain.

attributes.action: Stop electoral fraud by creating a national database of voters
attributes.background: There is insufficient rigour applied to the voting process and it is open to error and fraud because it is not national, has insufficient identity checks on an individual, and does not include an individual’s voting rights. A national database and appropriate identity checks would resolve this.
attributes.additional_details:
An individual, e.g. student or home-owner, may have two places of residence, in different local authorities. They are entitled to vote in both local authority elections but by law they are only allowed to vote once in a national election.
The individual does not have to specify at which residence they would like to cast their national vote, so they receive two polling cards and whilst it is illegal to vote twice there is no validation carried out to stop this.

attributes.action: Take back control of MP salaries, reduce MP pay to UK average salary (£27k pa)
attributes.background: Take back control from IPSA and implement a new pay structure method which determines MP salaries by analysing all UK salaries and sets MP salaries at the same level as the average UK salary, which is currently around £27,000 pa (2017).
attributes.additional_details:
Travel expenses to and from work engagements should be either refunded to the MP - or - MPs should be given free travel-cards to enable them to travel to and from work engagements free from financial expense.

This isn't about punishing MPs, it's about restructuring MP salaries to better reflect the values we hold dear in Britain; values of fairness and equality. In times of financial difficulty for many citizens in the UK, we need to make changes in the government that align with reality.

attributes.action: Request the UK government in the Brexit negotiations to agree 4 specific points
attributes.background: The petition is to ask the UK Government to agree on the behalf of The British Electorate 4 specific points.
attributes.additional_details:
We the under signed, request the UK government in the Brexit negotiations to;
1). Pay the EU nothing more. 
2). On UK sovereign matters, the UK Courts to have final jurisdiction.
3). Northern Ireland to be solely a UK issue. 
4). Immigrant quotas at the sole discretion of UK Parliament, with no interference from the EU.

attributes.action: Grant the Welsh Assembly the same powers as Scotland currently has.
attributes.background: The Welsh Assembly has been campaigning for greater devolved powers for years, and yet hasn't received any. It's only fair that all the nations should have equal powers devolved to them.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.prospectmagazine.co.uk/magazine/give-the-welsh-more-power

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-wales-politics-38643532

attributes.action: Provide free glasses on the NHS, for children with Irlens Syndrome.
attributes.background: Like many children with Irlens Syndrome, my daughter struggles to read. The words and letters "move around the page". This is not actually an optical problem but a problem with the way the brain processes visual information, and can be stopped by simply putting a coloured filter over the words.
attributes.additional_details:
It's possible to get a tinted sheet to lay over her work but this has to be removed for writing. 

To flourish at school she needs glasses with the correct coloured lenses so that she can see her work. They aren't available on the NHS as the prescription is a colour, not curved glass, leaving the parent to pay for a colourimetry test to find the correct shade and depth of colour, the frame and the lenses, costing about £250+ plus regular assessments.

To read, write and reach their potential these children NEED their glasses but are penalised due to their prescription. Glasses for Irlens Syndrome are vital to their education and should be provided on the NHS just like any other children's glasses.

attributes.action: Halt the cuts to military music.
attributes.background:
The Royal Marines, Army and Central Band of the Royal Air Force are an integral part of the the British Military.
If the cuts to military music are not halted national ceremonies such as Armistice Day will suffer removing the infrastructure and teaching process.  No further cuts to military music.
attributes.additional_details:
Bands have had a secondary role for some twenty years being trained as Medics. This was not some haphazard scheme but properly conducted by the RAMC Training school in Ash Vale and was as stringent and complex as the training given to their own trainees.

Bands did go on operations and supplied medical cover.

The scrapping of all Regimental Bands was a catastrophe and what remains of Military Music must be left in place.   

No further cuts to military music.

attributes.action: In 2019 hold a referendum to reinstate capital punishment
attributes.background:
It is a condition of membership of the EU that all member states do not practice capital punishment.

When we are finally free of the EU the people should be allowed a referendum to reinstate capital punishment.

attributes.action: Introduce a national awareness day specifically against plastic in our seas.
attributes.background: People are increasingly aware of how plastic, in all forms, is endangering sea and marine life. It doesn’t decay, possibly for centuries and we’re adding millions of new tons every year. Soon there will be more plastic than life in the sea.
attributes.additional_details: A National Awareness Day is the answer; a day on which all anti-plastic in the sea organisations and individuals could come together to maximise awareness. Britain’s ties to the sea are strong (historical, cultural, economic, geographic) and it would be great if our Government was the first to announce such a national day. Having a National Awareness Day is a win, win, win; for the oceans, people and politicians. There is currently no anti plastic in the sea day, we need one.

attributes.action: Ban or reduce the excessive brightness of LED or HID high intensity car lights
attributes.background:
Car head lights are now so bright that it's hard to see driving in the dark because you get blinded by the oncoming cars with high intensity discharge (hid) or led driving lights.
The law needs to be changed to greatly reduce the brightness.

attributes.action: Continue to recognise and allow the Inbound European Au Pair program post Brexit
attributes.background: We, the undersigned and BAPAA, are greatly concerned that the UK government has not prioritised the importance of Au Pairs to the British economy during the Brexit negotiations.  Our formal representations to government ministers have been ignored and yet Au Pairs are vital to the British economy.
attributes.additional_details: Thousands of hard-working parents rely on European Au pairs to enable them to juggle their work life balance.  Au Pairs receive pocket money and live as part of a family to experience British culture and family life and to learn English. This affordable program provides UK families with flexible childcare and enables young Europeans to study English and be introduced to British values at no cost to our government.  Brexit must ensure the continuation of this valuable cultural exchange programme.

attributes.action: Change the rules to allow gay men to donate blood more freely.
attributes.background: NHS has been crying out for people to donate more blood. Yet as a gay man I cannot do this as easily as others mainly due to the restrictions in place. Having to abstain from sex for 3 months as of 2018 is still not good enough. Gay men want to help save lives too. Help change the rules. Equality.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.blood.co.uk/who-can-give-blood/men-who-have-sex-with-men/

attributes.action: Stop explosive housing growth without infrastructure to support it
attributes.background: We call on the government to: (a) change planning laws and emphasis so that adequate infrastructure has to be provided alongside new homes; (b) provide grant funding where developer contributions alone are not enough to build new schools and health centres and improve the roads.
attributes.additional_details: This government is determined to build houses. It’s a free-for-all where councils don’t have a 5 year supply of housing land. Green fields around communities outside the green belt are targeted by developers. Local resources are overwhelmed, villages swamped. Country roads and junctions can’t cope. Growth should be spread evenly across council areas to avoid disproportionate impact, not concentrated in a few villages. Petition raised by East Leake in Rushcliffe but happening elsewhere too.

attributes.action:
adrenaline pens to be available in public and food places. 
social awareness
attributes.background: With knowing how important and life saving adrenaline pens are though past and present experiences myself If I hadn't had my pen with me it could of been different, so what I'm asking you to do is change the law, with potentially life threatening allergic reactions on the rise safety is paramount.
attributes.additional_details: The reason I want adrenaline pens to be available in public and food places, one; i'm aiming to ask to help reduce the stigma of not carrying life saving adrenaline pens, two; we all forget the importance of things, three; if your newly diagnosed you won't always get an adrenaline pen straight away. Finally social awareness is needed along aside,training first aiders to administer adrenaline pens. This simple procedure could save many lives.

attributes.action: To legalise handguns for fac holders
attributes.background: I believe that legitimate gun owners should be able to shoot a handgun because Northern Ireland do and so does the Isle of Man and jersey. You can say guns will increase violent crime but Switzerland has 1 gun per 2 people and have a lower crime rate than us. Fac holders should be able to do this to
attributes.additional_details: This will mean fac holders can own handguns for target shooting and self defence like Northern Ireland

attributes.action: Change the NHS 24 week revival rule
attributes.background: Currently doctors and hospital staff are under no legal obligation to help babies born before 24 weeks gestation, even though the youmgest baby to be born and survive was born at just 21 weeks.  Sign to give more babies a chance to survive and live full lives.
attributes.additional_details: 4 years ago my son was born at 20 weeks gestation, he was born alive and fought for his life for 2 hours before taking his last breath, he was given absolutley no medical help, and was just left in a cot to die because of this rule. I'm sure there are many more cases like mine, and there shouldnt be any more! The bottom line of a hospitals job is to keep people alive when they enter it that way, and premature babies are no different, if they are born alive they should be helped to stay alive!

attributes.action: We urge the government to reclassify medical negligence as a criminal matter
attributes.background: Too many cases of medical negligence are classed as a civil case and therefore the police are not required to investigate doctors involved. Any other profession causing death by neglect would be fully investigated by the police and handed to the crown prosecution service to determine charges.
attributes.additional_details: When doctors neglect patients they should be treated in the same way as any other profession research harry prockos case

attributes.action: Abolish the Solicitors Regulation Authority
attributes.background: We already have the Legal Ombudsman to protect the Public Interest. The Police and Fraud action cover any crimes. The fees generated by the SRA should be paid to the Government to set up an independent, fair and balanced body.
attributes.additional_details: A group of solicitors are now forming an action group as there is a real concern smaller firms may be being targeted by insurance giants who may be using the SRA to ensnare the smaller firms in tangles of red tape that handicap their ability to represent the general public against the insurance giants. This risks preventing access to justice for the public who can’t afford to pay a bigger law firm.

attributes.action: A review for tougher sentences for all of One Punch assaults and fatalities
attributes.background:
The law states that one punch assaults are sentenced to GBH which is up to 5yrs but usually get 2.5yrs. 
Manslaughter which is up to 10yrs but get 3 to 5yrs. 
The sentence does not reflect the severity of the damage that is caused by a one punch assault.
attributes.additional_details:
A review for tougher sentences for all of one punch assaults and fatalities. 
The law states that one punch assaults are sentenced to GBH which is up to 5yrs but usually get 2.5yrs. 
The sentence does not reflect the severity of the damage that is caused by a one punch assault: 
• Death 
• Catastrophic brain injury 
• Long slow recovery rate 
• Huge effect on victims , families, friends, community

attributes.action: Ban the use of Electric Shock Collars (Also known as E-collars) on Dogs
attributes.background: Electric Shock Collars are worn around a dogs neck and deliver a Electric Shock when the dog does not perform what is asked. These devices are unnecessary and cruel. Besides causing the dogs fear and discomfort they don't teach the dog what is actually desired.
attributes.additional_details:
They are already banned in Wales, so why not the rest of the UK? 

They are used by many who call themselves trainers but don't actually hold any training or behavioural qualifications. Seen as a 'quick fix' many are eager to rush into using one then to work on their dogs issues in a more positive way. 

Out walking i have personally seen many dogs who are on E-collars and due to their 'trainers' advice their owners would never leave home without them. This needs Changing. 

https://www.thekennelclub.org.uk/our-resources/kennel-club-campaigns/electric-shock-collars/

http://randd.defra.gov.uk/Default.aspx?Module=More&Location=None&ProjectID=15332

attributes.action: Brexit: Stop using ‘will of the people’ and ‘will of the British people.’
attributes.background: Government ministers are perpetrating a falsehood when advancing its affairs as ‘the will of the people’ or ‘the will of the British people’; taking its authority to use these expressions from the result of the EU advisory referendum of June 2016.
attributes.additional_details:
In the 2016 referendum, the Electoral Commission recorded the following:
Total electorate: 46,500,001
Voted Leave : 17,410,742
Voted Remain: 16,141,241
Rejected Ballots: 25,350
On the basis of these figures, the government in expressing the will of 17,410,742 members of the electorate as ‘the will of the people’ or ‘ the will of the British people’ is publishing a falsity when 29,089,259 members of the electorate did NOT vote to leave the European Union.

attributes.action: Reduce the content covered at GCSE History so that only 3 Units are studied.
attributes.background: The new History GCSE only caters for the higher ability students and covers over 1200 years of study. There is far too much to cover to do any of the topics justice, regardless of exam board. A limit of 3 units of study needs to be imposed to ensure these units can be taught effectively.

attributes.action: The Government MUST NOT let the ECJ override British justice after Brexit
attributes.background: Theresa May is considering giving the ECJ a role in Britain once it has left the EU. She held talks on a referral system for European citizens who remain in the UK. Judges in the UK would refer cases to Luxembourg should queries crop up that have not been addressed during Britain's membership.

attributes.action: A Bomber Command Campaign Medal honouring those who served
attributes.background: My Great Uncle lost his life as a pathfinder during WW2, we have no campaign medical for them; we had to raise the money for a memorial to those who served. It is disgusting that their efforts have NEVER been recognised.
attributes.additional_details:
Bomber Command Memorial Group, Bomber Command History Forum. 
Wilfred Cyril Riches RAF (V) DFC & bar pathfinder killed on ops 5/6th July 1944

attributes.action: End the new flight restrictions on passengers travelling from Northern Cyprus
attributes.background: In light of recent security policies in the USA, the UK has followed suit by insisting that passengers in transit from Ercan airport to Stansted (or U.K.) undertake extensive additional security checks at Istanbul airport.
attributes.additional_details:
Many passengers have been flying to London via a touch-down in Turkey for over 40 years without incident. Therefore This is perceived as a political decision. It has nothing to do with security. Ercan is one of the safest airports in the world.

This situation impacts the elderly and disabled, driving passengers south to Larnaca or Paphos airports.

We urge the UK government to reverse this policy immediately.

attributes.action: Schools to have mental health and disabilities a part of the curriculum
attributes.background: For ages I have and many others I know, have said that learning about health issues and disabilities should be part of the curriculum taught in schools. It could help limit if not stop the stigma and bullying.

attributes.action: Reform the UK Voting System - Adopt Proportional Representation
attributes.background: We call for a new debate & Vote into replacing the current First Past The Post system with Proportional Representation. FPTP is out-dated & only benefits the larger, more established parties. It is unfit for the modern times. PR allows for the views of the country to be more accurately representated
attributes.additional_details: We ask the government not to dismiss this petition as they have done before, as whilst there was a vote in 2011, with only a 42% turnout (& was described by political scientist Iain McLean as "bad-tempered & ill-informed public debate") ; We believe opinions and the political landscape has now changed, so before you reject this, Please do additional research this year and next, such as with YouGov, & social media and if opinions have changed, as we believe, hence this petition, hold a new vote!

attributes.action: Establish an independent body to fact-check the things said during campaigning
attributes.background: In a year where the Oxford English Dictionary names its Word of the Year as 'post-truth', then something has gone wrong in the politics & campaining world. This is a petition asking for the establishing of an independent department that will ensure truthful politics.
attributes.additional_details: We had the infamous claim that if we leave the EU, instead of sending £350 million a week to the EU; we can send it to the NHS; and then after the result declaring that we didn't actually send the EU that much money, & also it wouldn't be going directly to the NHS. This new department should consist of teams from Ofcom, Advertising Agency, CPS, ONS and electoral lawyers (etc) to ensure that no politician can mislead the public with unsubstantiated claims and that UK politics are truthful.

attributes.action: Exclude drone 'freestyle/racer' pilots from future drone usage restrictions.
attributes.background: The many 'near miss' drone incidents reported in the media involve drones requiring little skill to fly and piloted by inexperienced individuals. Restrictions would unfairly affect pilots of 'freestyle/racer' drones, which haven't been involved in such an incident to date.
attributes.additional_details:
The following 'drone incident' links all concern 'photography' drones.
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-39747042
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-london-39457371
https://www.theguardian.com/technology/2016/nov/17/drone-came-within-5-metres-of-passenger-jet-at-liverpool-airport

Below is some info on drone racing.
http://smashingdrones.com/what-is-drone-racing/
Most racers are >250g, so are affected. Drone racing is highly skilled and its DIY culture would make registering each drone unfeasible.

attributes.action: End entirely the BBC's self-regulating complaints procedure.
attributes.background: The BBC is currently in charge of it own complaints procedure. Only after three phases can a complaint be referred to Ofcom. I have, on multiple occasions, complained about BBC content from television and radio and not once has my complaint been upheld.
attributes.additional_details: I have requested statistical details of how many complaints are given rulings in favour of the complainant and no information has been provided. The BBC should not be able to self-regulate in this way. It is funded by the TV Licence fee and the tax payer and should therefore be accountable to its audience. The BBC should not be self-regulating and all complaints should be made directly to Ofcom. Ofcom should provide a comprehensive response to the complainant and full statistical transparency.
